newsitem.title: FRANCE: Axa at ease with 3.6-3.9 bln franc profit forecast.
newsitem.headline: Axa at ease with 3.6-3.9 bln franc profit forecast.

text.p: French insurer Axa is comfortable with financial analysts' forecasts of a 1996 net attributable profit of 3.6 to 3.9 billion francs, Pascal Thebe, financial communications director, said on Tuesday.
"We feel extremely at ease with this consensus of 3.6 to 3.9 billion francs," he said during a presentation of the results of U.S. unit Equitable Cos Inc.

Thebe said a drop in the contribution from Equitable -- to 1.391 billion francs from 1.549 billion in 1995 as a result of exceptional provisions -- "does not cast doubt on our forecast of strong growth in Axa's 1996 results".
Axa's 1996 results are due for release on March 26 and net attributable profit for 1995 was 2.730 billion francs.

The group is in the process of merging with insurer UAP to form the world's second largest insurance company after a deal announced in November but consolidated Axa-UAP accounts will only be published for the 1997 financial year onwards.
